official-title.#text:
Expressing the sense of the House of
		  Representatives on fully spending the receipts of the Harbor Maintenance Trust
		  Fund on United States ports and harbors each year, and for other
		  purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:
) submitted the
			 following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text:
affirms that the
			 surplus in the Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund should be spent down to zero on
			 the Nation’s ports and harbors as soon as possible; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to make all necessary preparations for
			 the expansion and acceleration of port and harbor dredging to be made possible
			 by 100 percent use of the receipts of the Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund.

text.#text:
urges United
			 States ports and the

Whereas ports and harbors play a vital role in the United
			 States economy;

Whereas ports move 2.3 billion tons of cargo a year in the
			 United States;

Whereas only a fraction of the harbor maintenance tax has
			 been spent on maintaining the Nation’s harbors;

Whereas the Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund has built a
			 surplus of over $8 billion, even as United States ports and harbors are
			 egregiously undermaintained and underdredged, reducing the Nation’s
			 competitiveness in the world and increasing costs for businesses and consumers;
			 and

Whereas the failure to spend the receipts of the Harbor
			 Maintenance Trust Fund to keep the Nation’s ports and harbors strong breaks a
			 trust with the people of the United States: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 236 IH: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives on fully spending the receipts of the Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund on United States ports and harbors each year, and for other purposes.
